snippet.title: Indigestible Recipe: Rice, Chicken Wings, and International Financial InstitutionsOr Hunger Politics in Haiti
snippet.description:
* Indigestible Recipe: Rice, Chicken Wings, and International Financial InstitutionsOr Hunger Politics in Haiti
Jean-Germain Gros
Food riots in Haiti in early April 2008 brought to the attention of the international community the plight of the Haitians. These events are neither unique to Haiti nor the product of happenstance. Instead, policies imposed on Haiti by international financial institutions (i.e., the World Bank and International Monetary Fund) since the 1980s, such as currency devaluation and trade ...
Journal: Journal of Black Studies - J BLACK STUD , vol. 40, no. 5, pp. 974-986, 2010
